alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 10:42PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Glasscock, western Mitchell, western Scurry, Borden, Howard, eastern Martin and eastern Dawson Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1042 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of O`Donnell to 8 miles southeast of Lomax. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Ackerly, Gail, Stanton, Coahoma, Forsan, Fluvanna, Sand Springs, Lomax, J B Thomas Reservoir, Luther, Westbrook, Vincent, Randalls Corner, Cuthbert, Knapp, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott and Ira. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 158 and 209. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Dawson; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry
